title: Secondary – Cycle 1 – Progression of Learning - Drama (2010)
subject: Arts Education

document.title: Secondary – Cycle 1 – Progression of Learning - Drama (2010)

0EB9C1D7572E4B0FB8D1F10FDA76F02D.description: Describes aspects of his/her experience related to the appreciation process and especially to the strategies used (e.g.use of different methods to develop his/her perceptive acuity)

1462C02CD4A4421196970752BBB29823.description: Describes important aspects related to the appreciation of elements of dramatic language, performance techniques, styles of theatre or elements of drama

9397EF68289640BE9513EC1E0B8347E9.description: Uses subject-specific vocabulary according to the terminology prescribed in this program

6C9BF525C4CF469CA587D8A25ED0FB1A.description: Expresses his/her preferences based on arguments related to his/her observations and the appreciation criteria selected

7A0F6D012DAF4DB1BA57032C3C216387.description: Compares short scenes based on his/her observations and the suggested appreciation criteria

03FF3564309F41ECB191DA168D741878.description: Uses subject-specific vocabulary according to the terminology prescribed in this program

390F73A2A6A2434FA96F75440DB55586.description: Makes connections between the elements observed and the meaning perceived (e.g. treatment of certain theatrical choices, of certain elements related to the character)

002D786D62204278A5FADE72537AD07A.description: Gives an example of the connections made between the effects of what he/she felt and the elements observed

F4B9382A173C4C56ACEA898CAEF13CCC.description: Interprets the meaning of the work

4C2AA54B91124629BB54F9022B560B7E.description: Picks out some aspects of stage directing (e.g. responses to sound and visual cues, conventions related to unified performance)

301C6424643B4A539559DFED50850041.description: Picks out some theatrical choices (e.g. costumes, scenery, lighting, theatrical techniques, sound environments, performance space, theatrical space)

3FD55B5CC27F45E5933A0223C7A009F4.description: Picks out some passages that include indications of time and space

2A4F3871DFE34B6190F25AB45CFC54AD.description: Picks out some passages typical of the genre to which the work belongs

3AE33CC7E7EF4963BDCC9316E525D540.description: Picks out some passages that mark the structure of the work (e.g. dramatic action, dramatic triggers )

93882549F0A44F7085F5A1E663CA2B91.description: Picks out different types of discourse used in the work (e.g. aside, stage directions, dialogue)

68C8D93005D247DE8497435A4FF0D1AB.description: Picks out body and voice in the performance of the work (e.g. energy, intonation, articulation, pronunciation)

A013C00F987C44C180EC9F49104A6446.description: Picks out elements of performance in the work for the purpose of characterization (e.g. attitude, gestures, gait, range, accent)

D80AFA4B9C2A400A944D6EF960012F63.description: Observes some of the following forms of expressions using the body: gestures, attitude, mimicry, movement and rhythm as related to the characters or the dramatic action

1AEB9B912DBC4658863380897577BFAC.description: Picks out the component elements of a work as related to performance, playwriting and theatricality (e.g. development of content, trajectory of certain characters)

4BE451A3E7CE41FEB87B3F2CAA5E89D9.description: Observes some subject-specific elements in excerpts of works of the present and past, from here and elsewhere

0C6AA49C7588444DA3307A878B130DE9.description: Analyzes a dramatic work or excerpt

005EE2A0652F4B8D9C7295E09917965D.description: Describes aspects of his/her experience related to the performance process and especially to the strategies used (e.g. identification of distinctive traits of the character, memorization of dialogue)

0B8EB731712B4049BB4A15DF5837C186.description: Describes important aspects related to the use of elements of dramatic language, performance techniques, styles of theatre or elements of drama

A99FF69B72574F8AA2CC143AEF5D4542.description: Uses subject-specific vocabulary according to the terminology prescribed in this program

B89A5E1D1BC84378981C2C54C63E3834.description: Learns sections of the work in sequence, taking into account the performance space and conventions

81B6E917981B42FDBA7F4B576E6AAC7B.description: Respects the conventions regarding unified performance

F20ED3A2FFBD4F68A02DD93937826A8A.description: Learns sections of the work in sequence, memorizing the text and blocking

EA3601DABF984800948D5FCA30B10ECA.description: Memorizes blocking related to the content of the story

8359D4F81AEE492F9E40605627D97C82.description: Becomes familiar with the expressive nature of the work

CBD57A0D2C444D68961301EFFA6341E6.description: Makes choices concerning the use of stage area and performance space

6DED7E304F1C4C0C86FE366781BDEDDD.description: Chooses costume accessories, elements of scenery, sound effects and simple lighting

AFBEDFAA0C0941CAA7B0631575717410.description: Chooses the costume related to the character in the story

02E29C40F26F456D96563D3508C5B7CA.description: Costumes, makeup, lighting, sound environment, stage area, performance space

DBD70D38B8B445668B7CCCE30CB0A49A.description: Tries out a characterization using body and vocal techniques (e.g. exaggeration, flexibility, breathing, rhythm)

33163CAF8EF2476AAD5A0BF18B48CD51.description: Combines some vocal techniques related to a character in the story: breathing, posture, sound production, projection of sound, pronunciation, speed of delivery, rhythm and intonation

6C562FC5B8544FE496A1E9E7E4BD0E4C.description: Body techniques and expression / Vocal techniques

1ECAD7C81800449A8D74F550A6F1A4FF.description: Tries out a characterization using the body (e.g. attitude, gestures, direction of gaze) and the voice (e.g. range, accent, silence)

31EF8450C5E24E14A08FDA5ECFF095FB.description: Chooses some different attitudes, gestures, mimicry, movement and rhythms related to the character in the story

5774EDCA71244EEBB6936B76A319DDF3.description: Picks out some stage directions, asides, indications of time and space in order to perform the work

9074263D32144A868D0EE1ABC2308A26.description: Picks out some elements related to a character for the purpose of playing the character (e.g. distinctive traits, intention, role in the action)

0D2E04D0958243C2A78EEB53E6EB3C02.description: Locates in the scene some elements of dramatic language to interpret the character in the story

92C7CC1792A741859AF15E21EBEBD0AD.description: Character, types of discourse, conventions, aesthetic traditions

E9C94742909543129BE0074E96F6468D.description: Identifies the genre of the work: comedy or drama

A31241B4EBD2409F82B6B9A0531D8349.description: Picks out some passages that mark the dramatic structure of the work (e.g. dramatic action, dramatic triggers

C8164C94AB2643B6BBB259193E0948EA.description: Locates the development, plot twists and the resolution of the story

C39E1D0088F246968ABD4F13D6B98B0E.description: Playwriting methods, dramatic structure, genres, dramaturgical forms

BF211400CA324D439A2AC98E9A4FF952.description: Becomes familiar with the dramatic content of the work

F3DD58BF22654977A21DBF131EEA4A00.description: Describes some aspects of his/her experience related to the creative dynamic, especially to the strategies used (e.g. strategies related to observation and listening)

20B26E7B858A410EAAA342F5341429AF.description: Describes important aspects related to the use of elements of dramatic language, performance techniques, theatrical techniques and styles of theatre

9DFB5D350F824BC59EFC886B48D84F5B.description: Uses subject-specific vocabulary according to the terminology prescribed in this program

4A92D91DDCC54B3DB465D914D3F81D72.description: Selects certain characters, dramatic situations and elements of dramatic language to refine the content of the creative work (e.g. types of discourse, character and building a character)

384F6BB09B7C46F9A7876A87BABA956F.description: Tries out different ways of organizing the content of the creative work

2A6B27802CD04AB086FB21C7481C7725.description: Organizes the content of his/her improvisations based on his/her creative intention

CDC9CB2CB2304B2296924878A6ACDA01.description: Tries out styles of theatre (e.g. performance in masks, body shadows, marionettes, clown performance, black theatre)

6C1BD476FA3C462BBCD4F464A29D3651.description: Uses the following elements of clown comedy: imitation, reversal of situation, parody of circus games, problem solving

19CF21DFDD18451C96564D318942474F.description: Selects the organization of the theatrical space (e.g. stage/audience relationship) for different dramatic situations

FA0DEB0BA3B04611836A54D2FD3322A7.description: Selects costume accessories, elements of scenery, sound effects and simple lighting for different dramatic situations

35A0632F623C4E7CB73268D2B213D8F0.description: Costumes, stage set, lighting, sound environment, makeup, performance space

684CC4A0BE2B4E1F84372ADA0D27FD21.description: Tries out a crowd scene based on appropriate dramatic situations

13B4C7519BAA4EE790CBA9BEA110D459.description: Tries out dramatic situations using the body (e.g. attitude, gestures, direction of gaze) or voice (e.g. range, silence, vocal effects) to build characters

B0039CD0792541FE9481F3B92BDA9E62.description: Finds some attitudes, gestures, mimicry and movements related to the character

9B4BA007A90C4C639826119F60F4700B.description: Characterization, ensemble work, body techniques and expression, vocal techniques

2B89B2AA12CF4284BDA27EC953D7800C.description: Outlines dramatic situations, inserting indications of time and space using improvisation

1FC1EC46E87E4E8FB7E20CDB6B987920.description: Outlines dramatic situations focused on dialogue using improvisation

3ECE28CEEA674182A43220B7C10C9108.description: Outlines dramatic situations containing dramatic actions and triggers using improvisation

D0F4F133CC244D5C9837BC62B301D96C.description: Playwriting methods, dramatic structure, types of discourse, conventions

5D57B899A55B4135822D16A41D0BCD52.description: Describes a character (e.g. distinctive traits, motivation, role in the dramatic action, historical characteristics)

CE3587FB0EFD485689E01381B725823F.description: Finds a few traits for his/her character

DB80F69A10194AF6A0D9A5C38242D26A.description: Outlines dramatic situations using improvisation focused on comic or dramatic genres

349E68324EEC4BC6B23F668CDCB5EE28.description: Uses elements of dramatic language and technique

9F95A6504FCC40D98BD7DE4C08BA494A.description: Finds ideas for dramatic situations related to elements of dramatic language that emerge from the stimulus for creation (e.g. role of characters in the dramatic action, comic or dramatic genre)

EA3C5D450C6B4A80B06BAF8C144C8019.description: Imagines a story with continuous development, with a beginning and an ending

7F2150A38DB44E38A17A4180148F23FB.description: Uses ideas to create a dramatic work

3C41C0B6CC8E44F19BA51ADEC5E78D73.description: Identifies the cultural dimension of certain references that can be used in the theatre (e.g. commedia dell’arte masks that reference the Italian theatre)

9D769CFC095246B3A479024FE47CBA9D.description: Names dramatic works from the Québec theatre repertoire and from the repertoire of other cultures

B606F94931C54DE4A77083D4001EAA41.description: Lists the following styles of theatre: performance in masks, body shadows, marionettes, clown performance, black theatre

1A67B8D47660487FB4AFE86CDAFFB2C4.description: Names the elements of shadow theatre techniques (such as: distance, body position, shadow, special effects)

DCBA72C7E153483F93052AD44DC70333.description: Identifies some aspects of staging (e.g. blocking, response to performance directions, response to visual and sound cues, adjustment of acting style to that of his/her partners, conventions concerning unified performance)

E808760A60BC4E72A43F2F02BE41DD82.description: Names some characteristics of lighting (e.g. function and use of lighting, simple lighting effects), sound environment (e.g. function and use of sound, sound effects) and theatrical space (e.g. stage/audience relationship)

76CC5424F86D432394477C1962DBED9C.description: Names some elements of performance space (e.g. wings, proscenium arch, downstage, backstage)

901095B9C52C4147AC3F3430C1670685.description: Names aspects to consider in developing elements of scenery: function and use of objects, visible set changes

AEFCF78449C349509ED0C929B6389DDD.description: Names aspects to consider in developing costume accessories: function, use

7B90AA5B02D2497F81FC5C34DFE7AB1C.description: Distinguishes playing area from the performance area

EC40CF4FCEE344D3908FE66E2522B1B4.description: Costuming, stage set, lighting, sound environment, performance space and theatrical space

D592C399A0AD46489B9B08D635652762.description: Names two types of playwriting conventions: treatment of time and treatment of space

3D542D251BB54CABAFCA95AE3DD80634.description: Identifies the following types of discourse: aside, stage directions, dialogue

283CC62FFBBF48A18848B13295B89A7B.description: Identifies playwriting methods (e.g. basic story line, writings for the stage, dramatic texts) and elements of dramatic structure (e.g. dramatic action, triggers)

14FD50FACD5D433D8AAAD5D76B47C071.description: Names characteristics of continuous story development (such as : development, plot twists and ending)

C7F602C1AE414E8999E9E8DB0EC083D8.description: Names the following aspects of emphasizing a character: distinctive traits, motivation, role in the dramatic action, historical characteristics

F64E37F83A5E4030BD0CE738B87B797C.description: Names some expressive elements such as character traits and characteristics of the story

9A6E1026F57344A28BC14401A1D0A117.description: Identifies techniques of voice placement (e.g. breathing, flexibility, relaxation, projection, articulation, pronunciation, vocal techniques, dynamic range) and diction (e.g. stress, intonation)

5E9A160318904A0A89CAF98226815C87.description: Distinguishes between the following vocal techniques: breathing, posture, sound production, projection of sound, pronunciation, speed of delivery, rhythm and intonation

AEC3E992784B4DDB8E7668A91B06E685.description: Identifies certain techniques of corporal expression (e.g. exaggeration, opposition, active relaxation, energy)

20C65EC6E66C45ACAE56198182DB85F8.description: Distinguishes between the following body techniques: relaxation, flexibility, rhythm, levels and energy

9E04F1D76B0745BAAC0EBB352B1740C0.description: Gives an example of ensemble work: crowd scene

64D99CD4D80C45C7917F87DA47BD9331.description: Identifies some characteristics of a chorus

4A7ECB06C9B14D3B952F2BBBC3600DCC.description: Names different functions of the body (e.g. attitude, gestures, direction of gaze, rhythm, gait, actions) and the voice (e.g. range, accent, silence, vocal effects) involved in building a character

8A171C69A94546189155A377DA0AE57D.description: Names two expressions using the body related to characters: attitude and gestures
